seriesStmt.title: Gregor Joseph Werner: A thematic catalogue of his works

annot.p: da capo of the first 20 bars
fragment of a Credo on fol. 23v and 24r (entirely reproduced in the incipit); four half notes per bar
da capo of the respective movement in Sanctus
a score by Hubert Dopf which he prepared for his PhD thesis

titlePage.label: [cover title]
titlePage.p: GREGOR WERNER | MISSA IN CONTRAPUNCTO | MISSA LYDIA | 1736 | C.M.BRAND

titlePage.label: [p. 13]
titlePage.p: Missa Lydia | Alla breve. | â 4 Voci. | Con | Baſso Continuo. | Authre Werner | [Ambros Rieder's remark from the autograph full score: Dieſes Manuscript …]

physMedium.p:
printed staff paper:
(1) “Sünova” Nr.6 1/2 16-zeilig (16 staves, 6mm)
(2) “Sünova” Nr.8 1/2 20-zeilig (20 staves, 6mm)

annot.p: a copy by Carl M. Brand from the autograph manuscript in A-Wn
This shelfmark comprises two works: The Missa in contrapuncto WerW B.7 (p. 1–12) and this mass (p. 13–24).
It is unclear why the masses are dated 1736 in this copy, since none of the existing manuscripts contains any date.

titlePage.label: [wrapper, fol. 21r, in Werner’s hand]
titlePage.p: Miſsa Lydia Alla breve . | â 4 Voci. | Con | Baſso Continuo. | Auth:re Werner

[below, in Ambros Rieder's hand:] Dieſes Manuscript iſt die eigene Handſchrift des | Gregor Joseph Werner, hochfürſtlich Esterhazischer | Capellmeister zu Eiſenſtadt in Ungarn um 1736, | der Vorfahr unſeres großen Jos. Haydn im Amte. | Ambros Rieder [MP]

annot.p: This signature comprises two works, the Missa in contrapuncto WerW B.7 (fol. 1r–20v) and this mass (fol. 21r–40v).
